DOC.detailed_description: COMBINED PET-MRI IN THE DIAGNOSTICS OF CHRONIC INFLAMMATORY BOWEL DISEASES ( IBD ) - A FEASIBILITY STUDY ( RESEARCH CODE T31/2014 ) 1 . Background Ulcerative colitis Crohn 's disease chronic inflammatory bowel disease ( IBD ) relapse remit course . The incidence IBD high teenager young adult , IBD may also affect child old people . The diagnosis IBD base clinical symptom , endoscopy histology bowel wall . Aims study The main purpose present study examine diagnostic performance combine PET-MRI detect colonic small bowel wall inflammatory process cause ulcerative colitis Crohn 's disease . The hypothesis study ) IBD-related inflammatory change detect PET-MRI ( 18 F-FDG ) correlate endoscopic histologic activity colitis ileitis . Study design A total 45 IBD patient ( ulcerative colitis Crohn 's disease ) age 15 year recruit patient visit outpatient gastroenterology clinic Turku University Hospital . Every patient undergoes colonoscopy biopsy specimen , endoscopic histologic data record via structured form . Laboratory specimen sample biobank obtain . Then patient examine abdominal MRI PET . Inclusion criterion : - informed consent obtain - age 18 year - diagnosis ulcerative colitis Crohn 's colitis base endoscopy histology - activity colitis confirm histology and/or elevate fecal calprotectin concentration - fertile woman contraception - previous abdominal surgery - X-ray investtigations precede year 2 .
